newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BETIS DEFEAT BOOSTS BARCELONA'S EUROPEAN CUP CHANCES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BETIS DEFEAT BOOSTS BARCELONA'S EUROPEAN CUP CHANCES.

text.p: Barcelona's hopes of taking Spain's second European Cup place were boosted on Sunday when rivals Real Betis unexpectedly went down 2-1 at bottom-placed Logrones.
With five games left to play, Betis are six points adrift of Barcelona, who beat Real Madrid 1-0 in a bad-tempered game on Saturday but who are still five points behind the league leaders.
Barcelona's biggest challenger for the coveted second spot now appears to come from Deportivo Coruna, who are level on points with Betis ahead of Monday's game at Valencia.
However Betis' international striker Alfonso Perez refused to be defeatist after the game, in which Logrones' veteran striker Ruben Sosa had scored a superb set-piece goal.
"Until we are mathematically out of the running for the second place we won't throw in the towel," said Alfonso.
Fifth-placed Atletico Madrid virtually guaranteed a UEFA Cup place for next season by beating Athletic Bilbao 2-1.
Curiously the goalkeepers of both sides were booked -- at different stages of the game -- for wasting time.
The Athletic keeper saw the yellow card before Kiko Narvaez knocked in the winner with a superb backheader from a Milinko Pantic corner.
Zaragoza pulled out of trouble with a 1-0 win over Espanyol, while Sevilla surprised fellow strugglers Hercules with a crushing 5-0 victory.
Eleven teams are still in serious relegation trouble, amongst them Sporting Gijon, 2-1 winners over Celta Vigo.
After the second Sporting goal Celta's troubled Russian midfielder Alexander Mostovoi left the field of his own accord in an apparent protest at the poor play of his teammates.
Mostovoi later returned to the pitch, but is likely to face disciplinary action.
"The club will probably take action ... The players criticised him for it afterwards," said Celta coach Fernando Santos.
